hints.content: Start by understanding the structure of the binary tree. Each node can have a left and a right child. The input tree is represented as an array where the index of the array corresponds to the level-order traversal of the tree.
Consider how you would traverse the binary tree. A common approach is to use depth-first search (DFS) or breadth-first search (BFS) to explore the paths from the root to the leaves.
Identify what constitutes a valid path. A valid path means that the sequence of values in the provided string must match the values from the root to a leaf node in the binary tree.
Think about how you can determine if you have reached a leaf node. A leaf node is defined as a node that does not have any children (both left and right children are null).
When checking the sequence, ensure that the length of the sequence matches the depth of the path you are exploring. If the sequence is longer than the path, it cannot be valid.
As you traverse the tree, keep track of the current index in the sequence. Compare the current node's value with the corresponding value in the sequence at that index.
Consider edge cases such as an empty tree or an empty sequence. How would you handle these cases? An empty tree should return false for any non-empty sequence.
You can use recursion to simplify your DFS implementation. Each recursive call can check the current node's value against the sequence and then proceed to check the left and right children.
Make sure to return true only when you reach a leaf node and the entire sequence has been matched. If you reach a leaf node but the sequence is not fully matched, return false.
Finally, remember to handle the case where the sequence is completely matched but you are not at a leaf node. This should also return false.

questionNotes: The binary tree is represented as an array in level-order traversal.
A valid path must match the sequence from the root to a leaf node.
Leaf nodes are defined as nodes with no children.
Consider edge cases such as empty trees or sequences.
Return false if the sequence is longer than the path.
